oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from William Thompson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing in May 1861 from McMinnville to someone named "Alex", Confederate soldier William Thompson writes of death of his brother, Jim, at Barrancas Barrack (Pensacola, FL) of typhoid fever. Continues on to say that companies are at Camp Trousdale and that "War, was, is the only topic." Writes "Our camp averages 162 lbs & the oldest man is 30."
